page.title: 02TRANSPORT
page.content: Roads provide the main means of travel. There are no railways in the area, although the West Coast Main Line is not far away. The M6 Motorway passes through a corner of our area, with a service area nearby. Other roads are minor ones, some being fairly straight and continuous, and others narrow, winding country lanes. Most families have a car, which is their main form of transport. Some people use their cycles for local journeys, or walk. There is an infrequent bus service, once a day, on the route between Carlisle and an outlying village.
